Player History
Won World Series with San Francisco in 1967...
Signed as a free agent by New York (N) on 2/5/1968 to a 4-year deal worth $4,000,000 per year...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1969...
Signed as a free agent by Philadelphia on 2/2/1972 to a 3-year deal worth $3,250,000 per year...
Drafted in 6th round, 105th overall pick, by Cincinnati in 1976...
Injured on 5/9/1976 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 6/2/1980 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for one week...
Injured on 6/16/1980 with a Tender Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 7/9/1983, off Steve Busby (PIT)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/7/1983, off Gary Nolan (PIT)...
Injured on 6/10/1988 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Traded from Cincinnati to St. Louis on 7/14/1990 (Going to CIN: 2B M. Lemke, 1B T. Martinez, C P. Clark. Going to STL: 2B S. Sax, P T. Henke, P L. Smith, RF B. Brower, SS J. Valdez)...
Signed as a free agent by Baltimore on 2/24/1993 to a 1-year deal worth $2,850,000 per year...
Injured on 6/7/1993 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for 3-4 weeks...
